00037 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00038 
00039 #ifdef HAVE_COMPAT_RDMA
00040 #include <linux/compat-2.6.h>
00041 #endif
00042 #include <linux/completion.h>
00043 #include <net/sock.h>
00044 #include <lnet/lib-lnet.h>
00045 
00046 static int   accept_port    = 988;
00047 static int   accept_backlog = 127;
00048 static int   accept_timeout = 5;
00049 
00050 static struct {
00051         int                     pta_shutdown;
00052         struct socket           *pta_sock;
00053         struct completion       pta_signal;
00054 } lnet_acceptor_state = {
00055         .pta_shutdown = 1
00056 };
00057 
00058 int
00059 lnet_acceptor_port(void)
00060 {
00061         return accept_port;
00062 }
00063 
00064 static inline int
00065 lnet_accept_magic(__u32 magic, __u32 constant)
00066 {
00067         return (magic == constant ||
00068                 magic == __swab32(constant));
00069 }
00070 
00071 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_acceptor_port);
00072 
00073 static char *accept = "secure";
00074 
00075 module_param(accept, charp, 0444);
00076 MODULE_PARM_DESC(accept, "Accept connections (secure|all|none)");
00077 module_param(accept_port, int, 0444);
00078 MODULE_PARM_DESC(accept_port, "Acceptor's port (same on all nodes)");
00079 module_param(accept_backlog, int, 0444);
00080 MODULE_PARM_DESC(accept_backlog, "Acceptor's listen backlog");
00081 module_param(accept_timeout, int, 0644);
00082 MODULE_PARM_DESC(accept_timeout, "Acceptor's timeout (seconds)");
00083 
00084 static char *accept_type = NULL;
00085 
00086 static int
00087 lnet_acceptor_get_tunables(void)
00088 {
00089         /* Userland acceptor uses 'accept_type' instead of 'accept', due to
00090          * conflict with 'accept(2)', but kernel acceptor still uses 'accept'
00091          * for compatibility. Hence the trick. */
00092         accept_type = accept;
00093         return 0;
00094 }
00095 
00096 int
00097 lnet_acceptor_timeout(void)
00098 {
00099         return accept_timeout;
00100 }
00101 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_acceptor_timeout);
00102 
00103 void
00104 lnet_connect_console_error (int rc, lnet_nid_t peer_nid,
00105                            __u32 peer_ip, int peer_port)
00106 {
00107         switch (rc) {
00108         /* "normal" errors */
00109         case -ECONNREFUSED:
00110                 CNETERR("Connection to %s at host %pI4h on port %d was "
00111                         "refused: check that Lustre is running on that node.\n",
00112                         libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid), &peer_ip, peer_port);
00113                 break;
00114         case -EHOSTUNREACH:
00115         case -ENETUNREACH:
00116                 CNETERR("Connection to %s at host %pI4h "
00117                         "was unreachable: the network or that node may "
00118                         "be down, or Lustre may be misconfigured.\n",
00119                         libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid), &peer_ip);
00120                 break;
00121         case -ETIMEDOUT:
00122                 CNETERR("Connection to %s at host %pI4h on "
00123                         "port %d took too long: that node may be hung "
00124                         "or experiencing high load.\n",
00125                         libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid), &peer_ip, peer_port);
00126                 break;
00127         case -ECONNRESET:
00128                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x11b, "Connection to %s at host %pI4h"
00129                                    " on port %d was reset: "
00130                                    "is it running a compatible version of "
00131                                    "Lustre and is %s one of its NIDs?\n",
00132                                    libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid), &peer_ip,
00133                                    peer_port, libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid));
00134                 break;
00135         case -EPROTO:
00136                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x11c, "Protocol error connecting to %s at "
00137                                    "host %pI4h on port %d: is it running "
00138                                    "a compatible version of Lustre?\n",
00139                                    libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid), &peer_ip,
00140                                    peer_port);
00141                 break;
00142         case -EADDRINUSE:
00143                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x11d, "No privileged ports available to "
00144                                    "connect to %s at host %pI4h on port "
00145                                    "%d\n", libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid),
00146                                    &peer_ip, peer_port);
00147                 break;
00148         default:
00149                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x11e, "Unexpected error %d connecting to %s"
00150                                    " at host %pI4h on port %d\n", rc,
00151                                    libcfs_nid2str(peer_nid),
00152                                    &peer_ip, peer_port);
00153                 break;
00154         }
00155 }
00156 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_connect_console_error);
00157 
00158 int
00159 lnet_connect(struct socket **sockp, lnet_nid_t peer_nid,
00160             __u32 local_ip, __u32 peer_ip, int peer_port)
00161 {
00162         lnet_acceptor_connreq_t cr;
00163         struct socket           *sock;
00164         int                     rc;
00165         int                     port;
00166         int                     fatal;
00167 
00168         CLASSERT (sizeof(cr) <= 16);            /* not too big to be on the stack */
00169 
00170         for (port = LNET_ACCEPTOR_MAX_RESERVED_PORT;
00171              port >= LNET_ACCEPTOR_MIN_RESERVED_PORT;
00172              --port) {
00173                 /* Iterate through reserved ports. */
00174 
00175                 rc = lnet_sock_connect(&sock, &fatal,
00176                                          local_ip, port,
00177                                          peer_ip, peer_port);
00178                 if (rc != 0) {
00179                         if (fatal)
00180                                 goto failed;
00181                         continue;
00182                 }
00183 
00184                 CLASSERT (LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_VERSION == 1);
00185 
00186                 cr.acr_magic   = LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC;
00187                 cr.acr_version = LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_VERSION;
00188                 cr.acr_nid     = peer_nid;
00189 
00190                 if (the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat != 0) {
00191                         /* single-shot proto check */
00192                         lnet_net_lock(LNET_LOCK_EX);
00193                         if ((the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat & 4) != 0) {
00194                                 cr.acr_version++;
00195                                 the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat &= ~4;
00196                         }
00197                         if ((the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat & 8) != 0) {
00198                                 cr.acr_magic = LNET_PROTO_MAGIC;
00199                                 the_lnet.ln_testprotocompat &= ~8;
00200                         }
00201                         lnet_net_unlock(LNET_LOCK_EX);
00202                 }
00203 
00204                 rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, &cr, sizeof(cr),
00205                                        accept_timeout);
00206                 if (rc != 0)
00207                         goto failed_sock;
00208 
00209                 *sockp = sock;
00210                 return 0;
00211         }
00212 
00213         rc = -EADDRINUSE;
00214         goto failed;
00215 
00216 failed_sock:
00217         sock_release(sock);
00218 failed:
00219         lnet_connect_console_error(rc, peer_nid, peer_ip, peer_port);
00220         return rc;
00221 }
00222 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_connect);
00223 
00224 static int
00225 lnet_accept(struct socket *sock, __u32 magic)
00226 {
00227         lnet_acceptor_connreq_t cr;
00228         __u32                   peer_ip;
00229         int                     peer_port;
00230         int                     rc;
00231         int                     flip;
00232         lnet_ni_t              *ni;
00233         char                   *str;
00234 
00235         LASSERT (sizeof(cr) <= 16);             /* not too big for the stack */
00236 
00237         rc = lnet_sock_getaddr(sock, true, &peer_ip, &peer_port);
00238         LASSERT (rc == 0);                      /* we succeeded before */
00239 
00240         if (!lnet_accept_magic(magic, LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC)) {
00241 
00242                 if (lnet_accept_magic(magic, LNET_PROTO_MAGIC)) {
00243                         /* future version compatibility!
00244                          * When LNET unifies protocols over all LNDs, the first
00245                          * thing sent will be a version query.  I send back
00246                          * LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC to tell her I'm "old" */
00247 
00248                         memset (&cr, 0, sizeof(cr));
00249                         cr.acr_magic = LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC;
00250                         cr.acr_version = LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_VERSION;
00251                         rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, &cr, sizeof(cr),
00252                                                accept_timeout);
00253 
00254                         if (rc != 0)
00255                                 CERROR("Error sending magic+version in response"
00256                                        "to LNET magic from %pI4h: %d\n",
00257                                        &peer_ip, rc);
00258                         return -EPROTO;
00259                 }
00260 
00261                 if (magic == le32_to_cpu(LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC))
00262                         str = "'old' socknal/tcpnal";
00263                 else
00264                         str = "unrecognised";
00265 
00266                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x11f, "Refusing connection from %pI4h"
00267                                    " magic %08x: %s acceptor protocol\n",
00268                                    &peer_ip, magic, str);
00269                 return -EPROTO;
00270         }
00271 
00272         flip = (magic != LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC);
00273 
00274         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, &cr.acr_version,
00275                               sizeof(cr.acr_version),
00276                               accept_timeout);
00277         if (rc != 0) {
00278                 CERROR("Error %d reading connection request version from "
00279                        "%pI4h\n", rc, &peer_ip);
00280                 return -EIO;
00281         }
00282 
00283         if (flip)
00284                 __swab32s(&cr.acr_version);
00285 
00286         if (cr.acr_version != LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_VERSION) {
00287                 /* future version compatibility!
00288                  * An acceptor-specific protocol rev will first send a version
00289                  * query.  I send back my current version to tell her I'm
00290                  * "old". */
00291                 int peer_version = cr.acr_version;
00292 
00293                 memset (&cr, 0, sizeof(cr));
00294                 cr.acr_magic = LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC;
00295                 cr.acr_version = LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_VERSION;
00296 
00297                 rc = lnet_sock_write(sock, &cr, sizeof(cr),
00298                                        accept_timeout);
00299 
00300                 if (rc != 0)
00301                         CERROR("Error sending magic+version in response"
00302                                "to version %d from %pI4h: %d\n",
00303                                peer_version, &peer_ip, rc);
00304                 return -EPROTO;
00305         }
00306 
00307         rc = lnet_sock_read(sock, &cr.acr_nid,
00308                               sizeof(cr) -
00309                               offsetof(lnet_acceptor_connreq_t, acr_nid),
00310                               accept_timeout);
00311         if (rc != 0) {
00312                 CERROR("Error %d reading connection request from "
00313                        "%pI4h\n", rc, &peer_ip);
00314                 return -EIO;
00315         }
00316 
00317         if (flip)
00318                 __swab64s(&cr.acr_nid);
00319 
00320         ni = lnet_net2ni(LNET_NIDNET(cr.acr_nid));
00321         if (ni == NULL ||               /* no matching net */
00322             ni->ni_nid != cr.acr_nid) { /* right NET, wrong NID! */
00323                 if (ni != NULL)
00324                         lnet_ni_decref(ni);
00325                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x120, "Refusing connection from %pI4h "
00326                                    "for %s: No matching NI\n",
00327                                    &peer_ip, libcfs_nid2str(cr.acr_nid));
00328                 return -EPERM;
00329         }
00330 
00331         if (ni->ni_lnd->lnd_accept == NULL) {
00332                 /* This catches a request for the loopback LND */
00333                 lnet_ni_decref(ni);
00334                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x121, "Refusing connection from %pI4h "
00335                                   "for %s: NI doesn not accept IP connections\n",
00336                                   &peer_ip, libcfs_nid2str(cr.acr_nid));
00337                 return -EPERM;
00338         }
00339 
00340         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Accept %s from %pI4h\n",
00341                libcfs_nid2str(cr.acr_nid), &peer_ip);
00342 
00343         rc = ni->ni_lnd->lnd_accept(ni, sock);
00344 
00345         lnet_ni_decref(ni);
00346         return rc;
00347 }
00348 
00349 static int
00350 lnet_acceptor(void *arg)
00351 {
00352         struct socket  *newsock;
00353         int            rc;
00354         __u32          magic;
00355         __u32          peer_ip;
00356         int            peer_port;
00357         int            secure = (int)((long_ptr_t)arg);
00358 
00359         LASSERT (lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock == NULL);
00360 
00361         cfs_block_allsigs();
00362 
00363         rc = lnet_sock_listen(&lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock,
00364                                 0, accept_port, accept_backlog);
00365         if (rc != 0) {
00366                 if (rc == -EADDRINUSE)
00367                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x122, "Can't start acceptor on port"
00368                                            " %d: port already in use\n",
00369                                            accept_port);
00370                 else
00371                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x123, "Can't start acceptor on port "
00372                                            "%d: unexpected error %d\n",
00373                                            accept_port, rc);
00374 
00375                 lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock = NULL;
00376         } else {
00377                 LCONSOLE(0, "Accept %s, port %d\n", accept_type, accept_port);
00378         }
00379 
00380         /* set init status and unblock parent */
00381         lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown = rc;
00382         complete(&lnet_acceptor_state.pta_signal);
00383 
00384         if (rc != 0)
00385                 return rc;
00386 
00387         while (!lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown) {
00388 
00389                 rc = lnet_sock_accept(&newsock, lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock);
00390                 if (rc != 0) {
00391                         if (rc != -EAGAIN) {
00392                                 CWARN("Accept error %d: pausing...\n", rc);
00393                                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00394                                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
00395                         }
00396                         continue;
00397                 }
00398 
00399                 /* maybe we're waken up with lnet_sock_abort_accept() */
00400                 if (lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown) {
00401                         sock_release(newsock);
00402                         break;
00403                 }
00404 
00405                 rc = lnet_sock_getaddr(newsock, true, &peer_ip, &peer_port);
00406                 if (rc != 0) {
00407                         CERROR("Can't determine new connection's address\n");
00408                         goto failed;
00409                 }
00410 
00411                 if (secure && peer_port > LNET_ACCEPTOR_MAX_RESERVED_PORT) {
00412                         CERROR("Refusing connection from %pI4h: "
00413                                "insecure port %d\n", &peer_ip, peer_port);
00414                         goto failed;
00415                 }
00416 
00417                 rc = lnet_sock_read(newsock, &magic, sizeof(magic),
00418                                       accept_timeout);
00419                 if (rc != 0) {
00420                         CERROR("Error %d reading connection request from "
00421                                "%pI4h\n", rc, &peer_ip);
00422                         goto failed;
00423                 }
00424 
00425                 rc = lnet_accept(newsock, magic);
00426                 if (rc != 0)
00427                         goto failed;
00428 
00429                 continue;
00430 
00431 failed:
00432                 sock_release(newsock);
00433         }
00434 
00435         sock_release(lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock);
00436         lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock = NULL;
00437 
00438         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Acceptor stopping\n");
00439 
00440         /* unblock lnet_acceptor_stop() */
00441         complete(&lnet_acceptor_state.pta_signal);
00442         return 0;
00443 }
00444 
00445 static inline int
00446 accept2secure(const char *acc, long *sec)
00447 {
00448         if (!strcmp(acc, "secure")) {
00449                 *sec = 1;
00450                 return 1;
00451         } else if (!strcmp(acc, "all")) {
00452                 *sec = 0;
00453                 return 1;
00454         } else if (!strcmp(acc, "none")) {
00455                 return 0;
00456         } else {
00457                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x124, "Can't parse 'accept=\"%s\"'\n",
00458                                    acc);
00459                 return -EINVAL;
00460         }
00461 }
00462 
00463 int
00464 lnet_acceptor_start(void)
00465 {
00466         struct task_struct *task;
00467         int  rc;
00468         long rc2;
00469         long secure;
00470 
00471         /* if acceptor is already running return immediately */
00472         if (!lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown)
00473                 return 0;
00474 
00475         LASSERT (lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock == NULL);
00476 
00477         rc = lnet_acceptor_get_tunables();
00478         if (rc != 0)
00479                 return rc;
00480 
00481         init_completion(&lnet_acceptor_state.pta_signal);
00482         rc = accept2secure(accept_type, &secure);
00483         if (rc <= 0)
00484                 return rc;
00485 
00486         if (lnet_count_acceptor_nis() == 0)  /* not required */
00487                 return 0;
00488 
00489         task = kthread_run(lnet_acceptor, (void *)(ulong_ptr_t)secure,
00490                            "acceptor_%03ld", secure);
00491         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00492                 rc2 = PTR_ERR(task);
00493                 CERROR("Can't start acceptor thread: %ld\n", rc2);
00494 
00495                 return -ESRCH;
00496         }
00497 
00498         /* wait for acceptor to startup */
00499         wait_for_completion(&lnet_acceptor_state.pta_signal);
00500 
00501         if (!lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown) {
00502                 /* started OK */
00503                 LASSERT(lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock != NULL);
00504                 return 0;
00505         }
00506 
00507         LASSERT(lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock == NULL);
00508 
00509         return -ENETDOWN;
00510 }
00511 
00512 void
00513 lnet_acceptor_stop(void)
00514 {
00515         struct sock *sk;
00516 
00517         if (lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown) /* not running */
00518                 return;
00519 
00520         lnet_acceptor_state.pta_shutdown = 1;
00521 
00522         sk = lnet_acceptor_state.pta_sock->sk;
00523 
00524         /* awake any sleepers using safe method */
00525         sk->sk_state_change(sk);
00526 
00527         /* block until acceptor signals exit */
00528         wait_for_completion(&lnet_acceptor_state.pta_signal);
00529 }
